abstract.p: List of some of Tito Puente's best recordings (S)

block.p: Tito Puente recorded almost 120 albums over more than 50 years. Here is a selection of some of his best work, including his vital dance music.
PETER WATROUS
CUBAN CARNIVAL (RCA). A cross between Ellingtonian orchestration and Latin percussion. Considered one of Mr. Puente's masterpieces. Recorded in 1955 and 1956.
DANCE MANIA, Vol. 1 and 2 (RCA). From 1958, orchestral dance music at the highest possible level, with Santitos Colon singing.
TOP PERCUSSION (RCA). A trip into Afro-Cuban religious and secular music, using mostly percussion.
MAMBORAMA (Tico). An instrumental album of mambos from 1959, with Mr. Puente playing vibraphone and showing off some of his more modern jazz arrangements.
VAYA PUENTE (Tico). Tough dance music from 1962.
TITO PUENTE SINGS THE EXCITING LA LUPE SWINGS (Tico). Rocking early salsa with one of the better singers of the time.

HOMENAJE A BENY (Tico). A three-CD set recorded in the late 1970's, featuring a series of salsa's best singers, including Celia Cruz, Hector Lavoe and Adalberto Santiago performing the music of Beny More.
THE LEGEND (Tico). An example of the modern orchestral dance music Mr. Puente was working on in the late 1970's.
ROYAL T (Concord). A late classic of relaxed Latin jazz, from 1993.
TITO'S IDEA (RMM/TropiJazz). A jazz orchestral album from the mid-1990's that features tunes like ''Woody 'n' You'' and ''Nica's Tempo.''
TITO PUENTE LIVE AT BIRDLAND DANCEMANIA '99 (RMM). A hard-core dance album that reflects Mr. Puente's band-leading precision; it won a Grammy.
